overview_of_class: In this course, we will learn what philosophy is and see how philosophy helps us to think about some of the toughest questions humans ask themselves: is there a God? What can I know with certainty? What makes life meaningful? How must I live in order to be a good person? What does a just society look like?
name: Introduction to Philosophy
title: WCAS PHIL 110-0-20 Introduction to Philosophy

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: In this course, we will learn what philosophy is and see how philosophy helps us to think about some of the toughest questions humans ask themselves: is there a God? What can I know with certainty? What makes life meaningful? How must I live in order to be a good person? What does a just society look like?

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students will be expected to be able to explain philosophical problems concerning God, knowledge, the meaning of life, ethics. and justice. They will also be expected to take positions on these matters and argue for their position.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: John Perry, Michael Bratman, and John Martin Fischer, Introduction to Philosophy: Classical and Contemporary Readings, 7th edition (New York: Oxford University Press, 2015). ISBN: 9780190200237

subject: PHIL
